To the chief Musician<S>5329</S> on Neginoth<S>5058</S>, A Psalm<S>4210</S> or Song<S>7892</S> of Asaph<S>623</S>. In Judah<S>3063</S> is God<S>430</S> known<S>3045</S>: his name<S>8034</S> is great<S>1419</S> in Israel<S>3478</S>. <sup>of: or, for</sup>
In Salem<S>8004</S> also is his tabernacle<S>5520</S>, and his dwelling place<S>4585</S> in Zion<S>6726</S>.
There brake<S>7665</S> he the arrows<S>7565</S> of the bow<S>7198</S>, the shield<S>4043</S>, and the sword<S>2719</S>, and the battle<S>4421</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
Thou art more glorious<S>215</S> and excellent<S>117</S> than the mountains<S>2042</S> of prey<S>2964</S>.
The stouthearted<S>47</S> <S>3820</S> are spoiled<S>7997</S>, they have slept<S>5123</S> their sleep<S>8142</S>: and none of the men<S>582</S> of might<S>2428</S> have found<S>4672</S> their hands<S>3027</S>.
At thy rebuke<S>1606</S>, O God<S>430</S> of Jacob<S>3290</S>, both the chariot<S>7393</S> and horse<S>5483</S> are cast into a dead sleep<S>7290</S>.
Thou, even thou, art to be feared<S>3372</S>: and who may stand<S>5975</S> in thy sight<S>6440</S> when<S>227</S> once thou art angry<S>639</S>?
Thou didst cause judgment<S>1779</S> to be heard<S>8085</S> from heaven<S>8064</S>; the earth<S>776</S> feared<S>3372</S>, and was still<S>8252</S>,
When God<S>430</S> arose<S>6965</S> to judgment<S>4941</S>, to save<S>3467</S> all the meek<S>6035</S> of the earth<S>776</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
Surely the wrath<S>2534</S> of man<S>120</S> shall praise<S>3034</S> thee: the remainder<S>7611</S> of wrath<S>2534</S> shalt thou restrain<S>2296</S>.
Vow<S>5087</S>, and pay<S>7999</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S> your God<S>430</S>: let all that be round about<S>5439</S> him bring<S>2986</S> presents<S>7862</S> unto him that ought to be feared<S>4172</S>. <sup>unto him: Heb. to fear</sup>
He shall cut off<S>1219</S> the spirit<S>7307</S> of princes<S>5057</S>: he is terrible<S>3372</S> to the kings<S>4428</S> of the earth<S>776</S>.
